channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2023090429
item.description:
Report X-2023090429

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal aerosol cans in corrugated carton without dividers. No hazard markings on exterior. One can dented and cracked at base by impact with adjacent can. Contents spilled, soiling other cans and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023090432
item.description:
Report X-2023090432

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jugs in corrugated carton with corrugated top liner panel. Loose caps on all four jugs allowed leakage which damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023090414
item.description:
Report X-2023090414

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-03
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking in the unload. Package was brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection, contents were found with all four containers having loose caps and having each at least slightly leaked. DescribePack: All four caps were slightly loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage tote with orientation arrows being followed.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was left in hazmat cage with email specifiying it was leaking. DescribePack: box is completely destroyed and liquid contents leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: pieces were placed in plastic hazmat bags, placed in hazmat totes, and put in hazmat cage for further processing.

item.title: Report E-2023100016
item.description:
Report E-2023100016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: GRAND JUNCTION
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UGJ. It was reported that an unknown quantity of Sikadur 42 Grout Pak (UN3267) was released from (1) 1- gallon metal pail due to a puncture from a nail in the pallet. A network contractor was dispatched to assist in cleaning. All waste was left onsite for XPO to manage.
